com.idevicesinc.sweetblue

Class WriteBuilder

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.idevicesinc.sweetblue.WriteBuilder

  • public final class WriteBuilder
extends java.lang.Object
    Builder class for sending a write over BLE. Use this class to set the service and/or characteristic UUIDs, and the data you'd like to write. This class provides convenience methods for sending booleans, ints, shorts, longs, and Strings. Use with BleDevice.write(WriteBuilder), or BleDevice.write(WriteBuilder, BleDevice.ReadWriteListener).

    • Constructor Detail

      • WriteBuilder

        public WriteBuilder()
        Basic constructor. You must at the very least call setCharacteristicUUID(UUID), and one of the methods that add data (setBytes(byte[]), setInt(int), etc..) before attempting to send the write.

      • WriteBuilder

        public WriteBuilder(boolean isBigEndian)
        Overload of WriteBuilder(boolean, UUID, UUID, DescriptorFilter).
        Parameters:
        isBigEndian - - if true, then when using setInt(int), setShort(short), or setLong(long), SweetBlue will reverse the bytes for you.

      • WriteBuilder

        public WriteBuilder(boolean isBigEndian,
                    java.util.UUID characteristicUUID)
        Overload of WriteBuilder(boolean, UUID, UUID, DescriptorFilter).
        Parameters:
        isBigEndian - - if true, then when using setInt(int), setShort(short), or setLong(long), SweetBlue will reverse the bytes for you.

      • WriteBuilder

        public WriteBuilder(java.util.UUID characteristicUUID)
        Overload of WriteBuilder(boolean, UUID, UUID, DescriptorFilter).

      • WriteBuilder

        public WriteBuilder(java.util.UUID serviceUUID,
                    java.util.UUID characteristicUUID)
        Overload of WriteBuilder(boolean, UUID, UUID, DescriptorFilter).

      • WriteBuilder

        public WriteBuilder(boolean isBigEndian,
                    java.util.UUID serviceUUID,
                    java.util.UUID characteristicUUID,
                    DescriptorFilter descriptorFilter)
        Main constructor to use. All other constructors overload this one.
        Parameters:
        isBigEndian - - if true, then when using setInt(int), setShort(short), or setLong(long), SweetBlue will reverse the bytes for you.

    • Method Detail

      • setServiceUUID

        public final WriteBuilder setServiceUUID(java.util.UUID uuid)
        Set the service UUID for this write. This is only needed when you have characteristics with identical uuids under different services.

      • setCharacteristicUUID

        public final WriteBuilder setCharacteristicUUID(java.util.UUID uuid)
        Set the characteristic UUID to write to.

      • setDescriptorUUID

        public final WriteBuilder setDescriptorUUID(java.util.UUID uuid)
        Set the descriptor UUID to write to (if writing to a descriptor).

      • setWriteType

        public final WriteBuilder setWriteType(BleDevice.ReadWriteListener.Type writeType)
        Set the BleDevice.ReadWriteListener.Type of the write to perform. This is here in the case that the characteristic you are writing to has more than one write type associated with it eg. BluetoothGattCharacteristic.WRITE_TYPE_NO_RESPONSE, BluetoothGattCharacteristic.WRITE_TYPE_SIGNED along with standard writes.

      • setReadWriteListener

        public final WriteBuilder setReadWriteListener(ReadWriteListener listener)
        Set the ReadWriteListener for listening to the callback of the write you wish to perform.

      • setReadWriteListener_dep

        @Deprecated
public final WriteBuilder setReadWriteListener_dep(BleDevice.ReadWriteListener listener)
        Deprecated. This will be removed in v3. It's safe, and ok to use this method until then.
        Set the BleDevice.ReadWriteListener for listening to the callback of the write.

      • setDescriptorFilter

        public final WriteBuilder setDescriptorFilter(DescriptorFilter filter)
        Set the DescriptorFilter to determine which characteristic to write to, if there are multiple with the same UUID in the same BluetoothGattService.

      • setBytes

        public final WriteBuilder setBytes(byte[] data)
        Set the raw bytes to write.

      • setData

        public final WriteBuilder setData(FutureData data)
        Set the FutureData to write.

        public final WriteBuilder setBoolean(boolean value)
        Set the boolean to write.

        Set an int to be written.

      • setShort

        public final WriteBuilder setShort(short val)
        Set a short to be written.

      • setLong

        public final WriteBuilder setLong(long val)
        Set a long to be written.

      • setString

        public final WriteBuilder setString(java.lang.String value,
                                    java.lang.String stringEncoding)
        Set a string to be written. This method also allows you to specify the string encoding. If the encoding fails, then String.getBytes() is used instead, which uses "UTF-8" by default.

      • setString

        public final WriteBuilder setString(java.lang.String value)
        Set a string to be written. This defaults to "UTF-8" encoding.
